Key Match Events: Tomasson scored for Iceland in the 69th minute
Ward scored an own goal for Wales in the 72nd minute
Johnson scored for Wales in the 11th minute
Wilson scored for Wales in the 29th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Wales will believe they are good enough to come out on top on Friday and few would be surprised to see them claim maximum points here.
Iceland have impressed on home soil - winning three and drawing one of their last four games - and we feel they could frustrate the Dragons in a tight contest in Reykjavik.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iceland defender Sverrir Ingi Ingason has returned to the senior squad after missing last month's international break through injury.
Wales secured a 3-1 friendly victory at home against Iceland in the last meeting between these two nations in March 2014.
Iceland are bidding to finish top of League B and secure promotion back to League A where they suffered 10 defeats in 10 games across two separate campaigns.
Others: The match took place at Laugardalsvollur in Iceland on October 11, 2024, at 7:45 pm UK time.
